action.action-desc: Mr. Phillips (for himself and Mr. Green of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010 to modify allocations under the State Small Business Credit Initiative, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the SSBCI Improvement Act.

section.header: Technical amendments to the State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010

subsection.header: Exception for allocated amounts less than or equal to $1,000,000

paragraph.text: Section 3003(c)(1) of the State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5702(c)(1)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(i), by inserting , except as provided in subparagraph (D) before the semicolon at the end; and
by amending subparagraph (D) to read as follows:

clause.text: may, in the Secretary's discretion, transfer the full amount of the participating State's allocated amount to the State in a single transfer if the participating State applies to the Secretary for approval to use the full amount of the allocation as collateral for a qualifying loan or swap funding facility; and

shall transfer the full amount of the participating State's allocated amount, if such amount is less than or equal to $1,000,000, to the State in a single transfer upon approval under section 3004 and subject to the requirements of paragraph (7).

paragraph.text: Section 3003(c)(3) of the State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5702(c)(3)) is amended—

clause.text: by inserting if the allocated amount under subsection (b) is greater than $1,000,000, before in the case of; and
by striking or at the end;
by inserting if the allocated amount under subsection (b) is greater than $1,000,000, before in the case of; and
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

if the allocated amount under subsection (b) is less than or equal to $1,000,000, for paying administrative costs incurred by the State in implementing an approved State program in an amount not to exceed 3.6 percent of the allocated amount.

paragraph.text: Section 3003(c) of the State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5702(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Recoupment of allocated amounts for certain participating States

subparagraph.text: With respect to a participating State for which the Secretary allocated an amount less than or equal to $1,000,000, the Secretary may recoup an amount of such State’s allocated amount as follows:

clause.text: If, not later than the last day of the 3-year period beginning on the date of approval under section 3004, an amount equal to 80 percent of one-third of such allocated amount has not been certified by the State as expended, obligated, or transferred, the amount recouped shall be equal to two-thirds of the such allocated amount.

If, not later than the last day of the 6-year period beginning on the date of approval under section 3004, an amount equal to 80 percent of two-thirds of such allocated amount has not been certified by the State as expended, obligated, or transferred, such amount shall be equal to one-third of the such allocated amount.

subparagraph.text: Any amount recouped under this paragraph may be reallocated by the Secretary to a Tribal government that was not a participating State subject to recoupment under this paragraph. In making such a reallocation, the Secretary shall not take into account the specific allocation for Tribal governments described under subsection (b)(2)(D).

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this subsection shall apply with respect to an allocation made to a participating State under the State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5701 et seq.) for fiscal year 2022 and each fiscal year thereafter.

subsection.text: The State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5701 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 3004(d)(2), by striking 12 months and inserting 18 months;
in section 3007(d), by striking the first March 31 and all the follows and inserting March 31, 2031.; and
in section 3009(c), by striking 7-year and inserting 11-year.

subsection.text: The State Small Business Credit Initiative Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5701 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraph (D) as subparagraph (E); and
by redesignating subparagraph (C) (relating to Separate allocation for Tribal governments) as subparagraph (D); and

paragraph.text: in section 3003(c)(4)(B), by striking subsection (b)(2)(C) and inserting subsection (b)(2)(D).
